<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Particles </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets particle source parameters using existing particle config from <tt>CfgCloudlets</tt> class. Use [[setParticleParams]] subsequently if you need to overwrite some values.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Important </title><part><name index="1"/><value> If <tt>CfgCloudlets</tt> class contains [[Simple_Expression | simple expressions]], they will not be evaluated by this command, which might make the whole class unusable in script.</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> source '''setParticleClass''' className </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> source: [[Object]] - particle source </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> className: [[String]] - CfgCloudlets class </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_source01 = "#particlesource" [[createVehicleLocal]] _pos01;
_source01 [[setParticleClass]] "ObjectDestructionFire1Smallx";
_source01 [[attachTo]] [_object,[0,0,0]];
</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[Arma 3 Particle Effects]], [[ParticleArray]], [[setParticleParams]], [[setParticleRandom]], [[setParticleCircle]], [[setParticleFire]], [[setDropInterval]], [[drop]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part></template>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 28, 2015 - 21:17 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Waffle SS.|Waffle SS.]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This can be very useful for getting features that can't normally be added with commands, such as AI view blocking and particles that can only be above/underwater.
</dd>
